results.title: K-Rad Man
results.brief_description: A Mad Scientist creates the ultimate computer virus and locates a suitable test subject: K-Rad Man - to whom he can expose the computer virus and gauge its results.
results.description: A Mad Scientist creates the ultimate computer virus and locates a suitable test subject: K-Rad Man - to whom he can expose the computer virus and gauge its results.

results.title: Drat
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Robert Stephenson, Ann Shenfield, Sarah Watt and Elizabeth O'Neill
results.brief_description: A bunch of lab rats one night decide to break out and escape from their cages in the laboratory. One brain damaged rat, as a result of receiving shock-treatment, initially resists the call. This claymation reveals in its close yet another fiendish experiment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Robert Stephenson, Ann Shenfield, Sarah Watt and Elizabeth O’Neill

results.title: Paddington in the hot seat. Paddington's puzzle. Paddington takes a cut.
results.creator_credit: Barry Leith, Ivor Wood, Graham Clutterbuck, FilmFair Communications and Paddington
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
1. “Paddington in the hot seat”. Paddington has an audience ticket for the Quiz Show “Sage of Britain”. He gets lost in the studio complex and finds himself “on camera” where he is interviewed by Lionel Parr. He disputes the scoring and provides his opinion on proposed changes to British Television. The viewers jam the switchboard and Paddington is announced “Sage of Britain”. - 2. “Paddington’s puzzle”. Paddington makes a jigsaw puzzle as a present for Mr Gruber from a “priceless” old painting discarded by Mr Curry, some plywood and glue. - 3. “Paddington takes a cut”. Paddington reads “Clippings from my Hedgerow” and dreams he is pruning Mr Currys’ shrub into a peacock shape. Disaster strikes when he snips it leg off! However, awakes before discovery by Mr Curry!
results.title_for_label: Paddington in the hot seat. Paddington’s puzzle. Paddington takes a cut.

results.title: High hopes
results.creator_credit: Mike Leigh, Simon Channing-Williams and Portman Film
results.brief_description: Winner of the International Critics Award, Mike Leigh’s tragi-comedy depicts Great Britain as a divided serfdom. One half of the population is in thrall to Dayglo dreams of social ascent, the other half to dissent and wistful radicalism. In converted slum-lands, yuppies live side by side with the last surviving council tenants, and in stubborn bedsits, the last surviving Marxists hold out, growing unwashed beards with the devotion of scientists. The film’s triumph is the depiction, at once satirical and compassionate, of its two aging Marxists, two lost souls like you and me, who soldier on with their small lives while the large world outside moves inevitably towards eternity or Armageddon.

results.title: Asterix the Gaul
results.brief_description: Asterix, the adventurous hero is the cunning little warrior to whom all perilous missions are immediately entrusted. Thanks to the magic potion of the Druid, he is famed for his superhuman strength. As if that were not enough, his mighty friend, Obelix is always ready to drop everything to go off on a new adventure with Asterix, although he is never allowed to have a portion of the magic potion because he fell into it when he was a baby. Wherever excitement and danger reigns, you can be sure that our intrepid pair will be in the thick of it. So Romans beware, here comes Asterix the Gaul. Based on the popular books by Goscinny and Underzo.

results.title: The Grifters
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Jim Painten, Robert A. Harris, Martin Scorsese and Cineplex Odeon Films
results.brief_description: Set in the sleazy horse-tracks and gambling dens of contemporary L.A., “The Grifters” is a modern crime film that compares favourably to classic Hollywood film-noir films. Based on Jim Thompson’s pulp classic of the same name, this film shimmers with a consistent erotic tension. John Cusack is Roy, a young con-man who makes easy money off the gullible hordes that crowd Los Angeles. He finds himself caught in the middle of a dangerous tug-of-war between his prostitute girlfriend (Annette Bening) who wants him to committ a major scam, and his elegant but desperate mother, Lily (Angelica Huston), who has been hustling for years and wants to find a way out. Both are powerful women not adverse to using the people they love to get what they want, and their desperate machinations to achieve financial independance puts Roy’s very life at risk. This brilliantly directed film is a powerful study on the corrosive effects of power and money on human relationships. All the cast is outstanding but special mention must be made of the majestic Angelica Huston: her blazing and frightening performance as Lily is unforgettable.

results.title: Brother sun sister moon
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Luciano Perugia and Euro International
results.brief_description: This delicate, handsome, quasi-fictional biography of one of the great saints of the Catholic Church, Francis of Assisi, focuses on the early years of his life. Saint Francis, who sought communion with the natural world by renouncing his family;s riches to seek his own destiny unencumbered by material possessions. Francis was, in a sense, history’s first “drop-out” ; he left a life of comfort to seek a spiritual union with the world. Starring Graham Faulkner as Francis and Judi Bowker as the young girl who eventually sheds her materialistic existence for religious poverty, this visually stunning film was nominate for a Best Art Direction Academy Award in 1973.

results.title: BMX Bandits
results.creator_credit: Brian Trenchard-Smith, Paul F. Davis, Tom Broadbridge and Nilsen Premiere
results.brief_description: Action filled fun entertainment, BMX Bandits stars a very young Nicole Kidman, David Argue and John Ley.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Trenchard-Smith, Paul F. Davis, Tom Broadbridge and Nilsen Premiere
results.description: PJ, Goose and Judy are three teenagers saving to buy BMX bikes. In their efforts, they stumble across a case of smuggled walkie-talkies needed by a bunch of crooks for their next job. Accidentally, while testing them, the teenagers alert the police on the same airwave band. The rest of the film becomes a BMX packed chase as the crooks and the police seek the trio. Action filled fun entertainment, “BMX bandits” stars a very young Nicole Kidman, David Argue and John Ley.

results.title: The Piano
results.creator_credit: Jane Campion, Jan Chapman, Saddleback Productions and CiBy 2000
results.brief_description: Jane Campion’s fourth feature is a visually sumptuous and tactile tale of adultery set during the early European colonisation of New Zealand, with Harvey Keitel daringly cast in the role of a passionately romantic lover and Holly Hunter as a woman physically unable to articulate her feelings. Ada McGrath (Hunter) can hear and communicates in sign language through her young daughter, Fiona (Anna Paquin), but she can’t talk. Apart from her child, Ada’s most treasured possession is her piano. She marries a man she’s never met, a pioneer settler (Sam Neill) in New Zealand. The marriage starts badly when Neill refuses to transport Ada’s piano to his settlement. Later, he allows George Baines (Keitel), who has ‘gone native’ to have the piano. Baines then offers to return the piano to Ada - if she gives him piano lessons. These lessons become stages in an increasingly erotic courtship. Campion unfolds this striking story boldly with flashes of unexpected humour. The settlement is chilly, muddy and rainswept, a place where civilisation is barely making an impact. Hunter played solo piano and acted as piano coach on this production. Paquin became one of the youngest actors to receive an Academy Award for her performance. Cast also includes Kerry Walker, Genevieve Lemon.

results.title: My little chickadee
results.brief_description: Mae West is teamed with W.C. Fields in this classic comedy filled with Wild West action and lusty humour. The familiar Westian swagger, drawl, wisecracks and innuendos are all included, likewise the typical Field’s routines and quick-triggered comments. The pairing of the two stars was at the time considered to ensure a box-office success, but it would see sparks fly with the clashing of two great super-egos. However a West-Fields non-aggression pact was inspired in part by the fact that the two players wrote their own screen story. Scenes in which the pair work together are reduced to a minimum with the script set up being a continual series of episodes, first with West and then with Fields. The story is simple; Flower Belle Lee, returning from a complete course in a Chicago dance hall, has a way with men. A masked bandit falls in love with her, which eventually leads to her being drummed out of town. Meeting Cuthbert J. Twillie on the train on the way out, she believes him to have money, and promotes a fake wedding ceremony. The pair hit the next fronteir settlement, where Twillie becomes the sherrif, and West tosses her charms around rather freely.
